title.narrative: Yes I Do Ethiopia

description.narrative: In Ethiopia KIT is responsible for conducting research on the root causes of child marriage, female genital mutilation & teenage pregnancies, testing the assumptions of the theory of change, and for measuring effectiveness of strategic interventions on child marriages, female genital mutilation & teenage pregnancies. This means that KIT is responsible for the base and end line studies, the midline and the operational research. KIT closely collaborates with local researchers and capacitates local research teams in mixed methods and knowledge management. The research has the aim to test the underlying assumptions of the programme’s theory of change, to measure the effectiveness of the interventions introduced by the programme and to look into the interrelations between child marriage, female genital mutilation and teenage pregnancy and the interventions that address these in Ethiopia. The research will contribute to the optimization of the Yes I Do intervention strategies and provide context specific knowledge for dialogue purposes, in order to move towards a situation in which adolescent girls can decide if, when and whom to marry and if, when and with whom to have children, and are protected from female genital mutilation/cutting. Furthermore KIT will lead on the validation and dissemination of research outcomes, and analysing country specific Monitoring & Evaluation data for lessons learned and measuring outcomes and impact of the Yes I do Alliance in Ethiopia.

mailing-address.narrative: Mailing address: P.O. Box 95001 1090 HA Amsterdam Visitor address: Mauritskade 63 1092 AD Amsterdam The Netherlands

title.narrative: Identification knowledge gaps and priority setting exercise conducted in consultation with YIDA partners in-country

description.narrative: Exercises to jointly in the YIDA determine what we do not know or for what topic more research is needed

comment.narrative: Identification knowledge gaps: In Addis Ababa two meetings were held with all alliance partners to discuss, prioritize and identity knowledge gaps. Priority setting: meetings with representatives of all organizations in Ethiopia were held to decide on the theme. First meeting in presence of two KIT and the national researcher, second organized and led by the country lead.

comment.narrative: Local engagement: A meeting was held from 11-13th of April 2018 with the research assistants to adjust and pretest the protocol . On the 16th of April a meeting with the alliance was held at Plan office Addis Ababa to discuss the midline and select the two study sites.
